colorants.name: White Kaolin Clay
colorants.benefits: Gentle exfoliation, adds slip to lather, helps scent stick
colorants.notes: Creates creamy white soap, safe for sensitive skin

colorants.name: Titanium Dioxide
colorants.notes: Mix with oil before adding to prevent clumping

colorants.name: Marshmallow Root Powder
colorants.benefits: Soft cream-white color, soothing, moisturizing, adds slip
colorants.notes: Creates gentle cream tone. Very mild and soothing for sensitive skin

colorants.name: Indigo Powder
colorants.notes: Can turn greenish in CP soap, may morph over time

colorants.name: Blue Spirulina
colorants.notes: More stable than regular spirulina, vibrant blue

colorants.name: Spirulina Powder
colorants.notes: Creates olive to dark green depending on amount

colorants.name: Chlorella Powder
colorants.notes: Similar to spirulina but brighter green

colorants.name: French Green Clay
colorants.notes: Gentle exfoliation, good for oily skin

colorants.name: Spinach Powder
colorants.notes: Creates soft green color

colorants.name: Nettle Powder
colorants.notes: Creates earthy green tone

colorants.name: Matcha Powder
colorants.notes: Creates vibrant green, may fade slightly. High quality matcha works best

colorants.name: Wheatgrass Powder
colorants.notes: Similar to spirulina, creates strong green color

colorants.name: Parsley Powder
colorants.notes: Creates soft to medium green depending on amount

colorants.name: Turmeric Powder
colorants.notes: Can stain skin temporarily, use sparingly

colorants.name: Calendula Powder
colorants.notes: Creates gentle yellow tone

colorants.name: Saffron Threads
colorants.notes: Infuse in warm oil first. Creates warm golden tone. Very potent

colorants.name: Annatto Seeds (infused oil)
colorants.usage_rate: Replace 10-30% of oils with infused oil
colorants.notes: Infuse in oil first, color depends on concentration

colorants.name: Pumpkin Powder
colorants.notes: Creates warm orange tone, fades slightly over time

colorants.name: Moroccan Orange Clay
colorants.notes: Creates earthy orange-brown tone

colorants.name: Paprika Powder
colorants.notes: Can be spicy on skin, test first

colorants.name: Carrot Powder
colorants.notes: Creates soft orange tone

colorants.name: Ginger Powder
colorants.benefits: Warm tan-yellow color, warming on skin, anti-inflammatory
colorants.notes: Creates soft golden-tan tone. Can be slightly warming/tingly on skin. Aromatic

colorants.name: Sea Buckthorn Powder
colorants.notes: Creates bright orange color. Very potent - start with less

colorants.name: Rose Clay
colorants.notes: Creates delicate pink tone, mild exfoliation

colorants.name: Rose Petals Powder
colorants.benefits: Soft pink tone, romantic texture, gentle
colorants.notes: Creates light pink-tan color with speckles. Romantic appearance

colorants.name: Raspberry Powder
colorants.benefits: Vibrant pink-red color, fruity scent, antioxidants
colorants.notes: Creates bright raspberry pink. Color may fade slightly over time

colorants.name: Hibiscus Powder
colorants.benefits: Deep pink to red, antioxidants, tart scent
colorants.notes: Creates vibrant pink-red. Strong color payoff. May morph over time

colorants.name: Brazilian Purple Clay
colorants.notes: Creates soft purple-gray tone

colorants.name: Butterfly Pea Flower Powder
colorants.notes: Creates blue-purple. Color shifts with pH changes. May morph to gray-green

colorants.name: Elderberry Powder
colorants.notes: Creates rich purple tone. May fade to gray-purple over time

colorants.name: Blueberry Powder
colorants.notes: Creates soft purple-blue tone. May morph or fade

colorants.name: Blackberry Powder
colorants.notes: Creates purple-burgundy tone. May darken over time

colorants.name: Acai Berry Powder
colorants.notes: Creates dark purple-gray. Very potent antioxidant properties

colorants.name: Alkanet Root Powder
colorants.usage_rate: Infuse in oil: 1 tbsp per cup of oil
colorants.notes: Must infuse in oil first, color morphs over time

colorants.name: Madder Root Powder
colorants.notes: Creates warm pink-red tones

colorants.name: Beetroot Powder
colorants.notes: Can fade over time, best in HP soap

colorants.name: Cocoa Powder
colorants.notes: Creates rich brown color, may accelerate trace

colorants.name: Cinnamon Powder
colorants.notes: Can irritate skin in large amounts, use carefully

colorants.name: Coffee Grounds
colorants.notes: Adds brown flecks and coffee scent

colorants.name: Walnut Hull Powder
colorants.notes: Creates deep brown tones

colorants.name: Activated Charcoal
colorants.benefits: Black color, detoxifying, draws out impurities
colorants.notes: Start with less, very potent. Can cause lather to gray

colorants.name: Black Oxide
colorants.notes: Lab-made but soap-safe, very concentrated

colorants.name: Bentonite Clay
colorants.notes: Creates neutral tan tone, good for sensitive skin

colorants.name: Rhassoul Clay
colorants.notes: Creates warm earthy tones
